Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: おばあさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの息子は、祭司様の お手伝いをしているのさ。
Entry.EnglishText: My son is aiding the priest.

Entry.JapaneseText: 蒼獣様のためにつくす事こそ、 この街に住む者の喜びさね。
Entry.EnglishText: Serving the Azure Beast always brings the people here joy.

Entry.JapaneseText: 祭司様の言葉？ ……<Cyan>「とし」<White>の事を言ってたかね。
Entry.EnglishText: You want to know what the priest said? It was something about a "bee," I think.

Entry.JapaneseText: 蒼獣様の前にあっては、 <Yellow>ヒト<White>の区別など、男女の違いの 他に何があろうか……！
Entry.EnglishText: Other than being a man or a woman, what differences are there amongst <Yellow>Humanity<White> in the presence of the Azure Beast?

Entry.JapaneseText: 何百年もの間、同じ<Yellow>ヒト<White>として ヒューマもガジュマもなく 暮らしてきたというのに……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma and Gajuma had been living here as fellow <Yellow>Man<White> for centuries, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: もともと祭司はガジュマと ヒューマから公平に順番に 決められていたのじゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: In the past, the position of priest would rotate fairly between Huma and Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: それをガジュマもヒューマも <Blue>蒼獣聖典<White>の記述を挙げて、 祭司の権利を互いに主張し始めた。
Entry.EnglishText: Now everyone is citing passages from the Azure Beast's Scripture to justify which race has a right to the priesthood.

Entry.JapaneseText: ほんに馬鹿馬鹿しい。 祭司はふさわしい者がやれば良いのだ。 蒼獣様は笑っておられるぞ……
Entry.EnglishText: It's absurd! The priest must be decided based on who's worthy. Oh, the Azure Beast must be laughing at us now...

Entry.JapaneseText: これでいいんじゃ、 これで……
Entry.EnglishText: Hopefully things will get better now...

Entry.JapaneseText: 祭司の問題は、いずれきちんと 話し合わねばならんな……
Entry.EnglishText: Eventually, we will have to have a proper discussion on the issues related to the priesthood.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何があっても心を乱してはならん。 安心せよ……祈りを奉げる者に、 蒼獣様は手を差し伸べてくださる……！
Entry.EnglishText: No matter what happens, do not allow your mind to be disturbed! Be assured, the Azure Beast will reach out to those who pray.

Entry.JapaneseText: リフトにはもう乗ったか？ すごかろうて？ この街の名物さ。
Entry.EnglishText: This town is famous for its lift. Have you ridden it yet? Isn't it grand?

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律か……
Entry.EnglishText: Right, the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか……戒律のせいで しゃべれないんだったネ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh right... She can't talk to me because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、男とは 話せないようだな……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems that she can't talk to men because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律……ですね。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh...the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか、戒律が あったんだったな……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh right, those commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、女と 話せないんだったわね……
Entry.EnglishText: He isn't allowed to talk to women because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『乾蔵庫』 バビログラードでは一般的な 木製の食料品保存庫。 通気性が非常に良いので、 食品の長期保存が可能。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Pantry - A wooden pantry commonly found in Babilograd. Due to its great ventilation, food can be stored here for a long time.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『乾蔵庫の中身』 木の実とキノコしか入ってない。 朝昼晩三食とおやつ、夜食にも 木の実やキノコが欠かせないのが バビログラードの食生活。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Pantry's Contents - It only contains nuts and mushrooms. Every meal of the day in Babilograd, including snacks, consists of these ingredients.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『深底のなべ』 料理は終わっているが、 荒熱を冷ましている最中。 そこはかとなくいい香りが 漂っている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Deep Stock Pot - Whatever is in it is finished cooking and has been left to cool. There's a delicious aroma wafting from it.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『深底なべの中身』 二十八種類の木の実をブレンドして 甘く煮付けたものが山のように入っている。 ごはんのおかずにもおやつにも最高。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Stock Pot's Contents - A blend of 28 varieties of sweetly simmered nuts are piled up inside. Great as either a side dish or a snack.
Entry.Notes: Not sure if 木の実 should be fruits
